speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, Sophie, I'm listening.

speaker: Sophie
text: [_v.o._] Hi, Dr. Crane.  My husband's having some of his friends over to watch the game Sunday, and I think it'd be nice if I could have some of my girlfriends over too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds reasonable.

speaker: Sophie
text: Exactly. I mean, it's just football.

speaker: Larry
text: [_in the background_] Not football, Einstein, the Super Bowl.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, that would be your doting husband now.

speaker: Sophie
text: Larry, this is a private conversation.  And for God's sake, use a plate!

speaker: Frasier
text: Sophie, why don't you put your husband on the line?

speaker: Sophie
text: Pick up.

speaker: Larry
text: Ah, geez. [_picks up, louder_] Hello!

speaker: Frasier
text: Larry, I gotta tell you, I'm afraid I side with your wife on this one.

speaker: Larry
text: That just proves you don't know the first thing about football.

speaker: Frasier
text: What I do or do not know about football has...

speaker: Larry
text: OK, how's this: My wife's friends can come over if you can answer even one little football question.  Like...

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, I don't see that that's in any...

speaker: Larry
text: You're down by six, you're on your own forty, three seconds left, what do you do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, you would...

speaker: Frasier
text: You would take your receivers, [_Roz sets them together_] and line them up, [_she pretends to throw_] and then throw a pass. [_big throwing gesture_] A long, long pass.

speaker: Larry
text: Yeah, and what's the name for that? _Roz gets down on her knees, crosses herself, and prays with an innocent look on her face._

speaker: Frasier
text: A Hail Mary. [_Roz gives him the thumbs up._] Sophie and Larry, I hope you enjoy the game.  In the meanwhile, this is Coach Crane saying, I'm listening.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm impressed you're so good at charades.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm impressed you could mime a virgin.  So, Roz, you walkin' out?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I got stuff I gotta do.  I've got some carts to rack, and I want to put together some Best of Crane tapes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, your mother's still in town?

speaker: Roz
text: In town, in my apartment, and when I left this morning, in my refrigerator, smelling my milk!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.

speaker: Roz
text: I, I love her, I just wish I could get a couple of hours to myself one night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why don't you just ask her?  She might enjoy a little time to herself.  I know my dad does.

speaker: Roz
text: You are so lucky.  I wish my mother drank alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, your mom's about the same age as my dad, isn't she?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I guess.

speaker: Frasier
text: Does she date much?

speaker: Roz
text: Since my father left, practically never... no, hang on...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, hear me out, Roz.  Now, Dad hasn't dated anybody since he and Sherry broke up, I'm starting to worry he's lost his nerve.  A date with your mom could be a tremendous favor to him.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, I'll tell you what: I know it's awkward but there's a way to minimize that.  Niles and I are having dinner with him tonight.  We'll take him to McGinty's, he'll feel comfortable, you and your mother can just happen by.  We'll see what transpires, you know, they'll never even know it's a fix-up.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, what the hell, I'll give it a shot, I guess.  How's five sound?

speaker: Frasier
text: Five?  Your mother is ready for dinner at five?

speaker: Roz
text: I keep her on Wisconsin time, that way she's in bed by eight.   **A.K.A THE LAST ONION OUT OF POMPEII**  _Scene 2 - McGinty's Fade in.  Niles and Frasier are sitting at a table, Martin brings a plate over._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, look what I got here, boys!  A Funion Onion.  The chef sent it over with his compliments.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wonder what his insults are like.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to a waitress_] Hey, Bonnie!

speaker: Bonnie
text: Hey ya, Marty.  Oh, you must be Frasier, the big radio star.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  Hello.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Your dad is so proud of you, he talks about you all the time. Who's your friend?

speaker: Martin
text: Now, what's wrong with you?  I told you about my other son.

speaker: Bonnie
text: [_shaking Niles's hand_] Oh, of course, what am I thinking? Nice to meet you, Eddie.

speaker: Martin
text: This is Niles.  How 'bout some beers, Bonnie?

speaker: Bonnie
text: Coming right up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh God, look.  The group coming in the door, they're from the Shangri-La. _A group of guys come over and punch Niles on the shoulder.  He puts up his fists and weaves back and forth._

speaker: Jimbo
text: Whoa, it's the Coyote!

speaker: Niles
text: Evening, evening, Jimbo.  Check you later.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, you got a nickname down there already.  That's great! The Coyote?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how did you earn that honorific?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it was quite the merry road.  Yes.  It evolved from Niles to Nilesy to Niley to Nile E. Coyote and now simply "The Coyote."

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, just when I thought it couldn't be refined any further.   [_N.B. Eva Marie Saint's first (and Oscar-winning) film role was as Edie Doyle, Marlon Brando's love interest in 1954's "On the Waterfront."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, goodness, look who's here!  Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: What?  We don't see enough of each other during the day?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Joanna.

speaker: Joanna
text: Nice to see you again, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice to see you again, too.  Please, won't you sit down and join us?

speaker: Joanna
text: Oh, no, we don't want to intrude.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, please, the more the merrier.

speaker: Roz
text: All right.  Mom, this is Frasier's dad, Martin Crane.  This is my mom, Joanna Doyle.

speaker: Martin
text: Very nice to meet you.  And this is my other son, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: How do you do?

speaker: Joanna
text: It's a pleasure.  _DISSOLVE TO: after dinner.  Martin and Joanna have cleaned their plates, while the others still have food._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, will you just look at the two of them.

speaker: Roz
text: How did you two manage to finish all that?

speaker: Joanna
text: Oh, please.  This is how our generation ate every day.  I used to live on cigarettes, whiskey sours and bacon cheeseburgers.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and what about breakfast?  Fried eggs, sausage patties, hash browns...

speaker: Niles
text: My God, last night I ate a profiterole and lay awake 'til dawn waiting for my heart attack.

speaker: Joanna
text: Those were simpler times, weren't they, Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, we didn't worry about dumb things like cholesterol. We worried about puttin' food on the table, keepin' the yard clean and the car shiny.

speaker: Joanna
text: And the H-bomb.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yeah, that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, Roz, we better be going if we're going to get that work done tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I should be going too.

speaker: Roz
text: Mom and me are going to that jazz club on Fifth.

speaker: Frasier
text: But we promised to finish those promos tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, right.  Mom, I'm sorry, I totally forgot.

speaker: Joanna
text: It's OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, I've got an idea.  Uh, Dad, since I'm kidnapping Roz, why don't you take Joanna to the jazz club?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, sure, I'd love to.

speaker: Roz
text: Is that OK with you, Mom?

speaker: Joanna
text: If Martin's game, I'm game.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, perfect.  OK, you kids just have some coffee, we'll see you back at the apartment later, OK?

speaker: Joanna
text: All right.

speaker: Niles
text: Very, very nice to meet you.

speaker: Joanna
text: Thank you.

speaker: Joanna
text: Look at them.  They think we don't know this is a setup.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, how could we figure it out?  We're just a retired detective and an attorney general. [_they laugh_]

speaker: Roz
text: You were absolutely right, they didn't suspect a thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: I told you Roz, just leave it to the master.  _FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment. Fade in.  Daphne is sitting in Martin's chair eating popcorn and watching television.  Roz brings another bowl in from the kitchen. Frasier is on the couch._

speaker: Roz
text: God, I thought they'd be home by now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, will you please relax and watch the pageant with us? They're right in the middle of the talent competition. [_She sits next to him._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's shameless the way they're sucking up to the international panel of judges.  Miss Germany just played "Lady of Spain" on a French horn.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you're gonna chew that nail right off.  Stop it.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't help it.  I'm nervous.  Do you think it's gonna turn out OK?

speaker: Frasier
text: Who cares?

speaker: Daphne
text: Not for Miss Brazil.  Look at the tree trunks on her. She's her own little rain forest.

speaker: Roz
text: I just keep worrying that she's gonna have a lousy time, and it will be all my fault.  Screwing up, like always.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Roz.  Your mother doesn't think you're a screwup.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah?  In high school, I ran my own informal shoplifting clinic.  In college, I dropped out of pre-law because it interfered with Bruce Springsteen's touring schedule.  And now I'm an unwed mother.  What would you call me?

speaker: Daphne
text: Tramp.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: It's Miss Venezuela.  If that dress of hers was slit any higher, you could see Caracas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, Roz.  You know what?  So what if they don't get along? So we made a mistake.

speaker: Roz
text: [_getting up for some sherry_] You don't understand.  My mother doesn't make mistakes.  She does everything well.  She's smart, successful, classy... oh, what the hell was I thinking?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] About what?  Setting her up with my father?

speaker: Roz
text: No, that's not what I meant.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is exactly what you meant!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, OK, Frasier.  No offense, your father is a very nice man, but let's face it: My mother was the attorney general of Wisconsin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I hope he remembers to curtsey before the Dairy Queen!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_getting up_] This is ridiculous.  I'm going to watch this in my room.  Miss Finland just laid out her plan to end world hunger, and I missed it!  _She goes off to her room.  There is the sound of the key in the lock at the front door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, that is the best promo of all.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hi!  How was your evening?

speaker: Joanna
text: Oh, the jazz was first rate.  But I'm afraid I talked Martin's ear off.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you're crazy.  Your mother tells wonderful stories, Roz. I could have listened to her all night.

speaker: Joanna
text: You are either too kind or a little tipsy.  But thank you. Come on, Lammy.  I really had a lovely time.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I can't remember when I had a better time.  We're gonna have to do this again.

speaker: Joanna
text: Bye, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodnight, Joanna.  Lammy.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grinning_] So... Tell me all about it.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, being a gentleman, I don't want to go into the details, so suffice it to say, it STUNK!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: [_putting up his coat_] That was the dullest evening of my life. The way she drones on and on.  Do you know how many metric tons of eggs Wisconsin produces every year?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I do!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh...

speaker: Martin
text: Look, Frasier, I know you meant well, but if you ever set me up again, I'll kill you in your sleep.  Goodnight.  _He goes off to bed.  There is a quiet but insistent knocking at the door.  Frasier opens it to reveal Roz._

speaker: Roz
text: [_excited_] I told my mom to meet me downstairs.  I just had to come up and tell you.  She had the best time!  She can't wait to go out with your father again.  Will you tell him to call her tomorrow?  Oh, Frasier, this whole thing worked out like a dream!

speaker: Martin
text: [_crossing to the kitchen_] It's amazing!  Her voice is still echoing in my head!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's like a fairy tale over here, too.  _Roz leaves.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa. Fade in.  Frasier and Niles are standing at the counter._

speaker: Frasier
text: I've just got to find some way to tell Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: Why?  It's just going to hurt her mom's feelings.

speaker: Frasier
text: Her feelings are going to be hurt anyway.  She's here 'til Sunday.  She's expecting him to call.  Oh, dear God.  At least this way Roz can let her down easy.

speaker: Niles
text: Looks like both of us have difficult conversations ahead of us.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's yours?

speaker: Niles
text: All week long, I have been getting less coffee and more foam in my cappuccino.  It's about time for someone to raise a little hell.  Who's on steamer duty?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's that hulking fellow, Thad.  The one who doesn't react when his arm touches the steamer nozzle.

speaker: Niles
text: Where is that suggestion box?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Double espresso to go, please. [_Roz and Frasier sit._] Listen, I really need to thank you again. My mother had the best time last night.  And when we got home, WE started talking.  We ended up staying up half the night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz I'm glad for you, but...

speaker: Roz
text: It was like a wall came down.  She just opened up to me. She started talking about how hard it was on her when my dad left, and how lonely she's been, and it was like she was talking to a girlfriend instead of her screw-up daughter.  So, has Martin called her yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  But he will.  Soon.  Uh, he had a really busy morning.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, how does this weekend look?  'Cause she's leaving Sunday night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sunday?  Oh, well let's see, tonight is poker night, that's no good.  Saturday he's made plans to, uh, drive Duke to Tacoma for that all day... Tacoma-Fest.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, on Sunday we go to a matinee and then I drive her to the airport.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, darn.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait a minute.  I can give my ticket to Martin and they can go together.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Sunday's no good, because that's the, uh...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh right, it's the Super Bowl!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, the Super Bowl.  You know how Dad is about football, it's like a religion with him.  In fact, he's made Niles and I promise that we'd watch it with him this year.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, well, OK.  Let's just forget about the tickets and we'll come over and watch the game.  Is there any reason why that won't work?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not that I can come up with.

speaker: Roz
text: That's great, my mom's going to be so excited. [_She turns to pay her bill, Niles takes it and puts it on the counter._] Oh, thank you, Niles.  I'll see you Sunday at your Super Bowl party.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting_] I see you told Roz the news and she went insane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Couldn't do it.  Told her we were watching the Super Bowl with Dad and she and her mother are coming over.

speaker: Niles
text: This is a nightmare!

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.  I've got to find some way to tell Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: I have to watch the Super Bowl?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose the sooner I tell him, the better.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, not necessarily.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you know Dad.  If you warn him Joanna's coming over, he'll just bolt to McGinty's.  If I were you, I'd wait until five minutes before game time and then spring it on him.  That way he has no choice but to stay.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think I owe him more than five minutes' warning.  Besides, Dad would never deliberately hurt Joanna standing her up. He is first and foremost a gentleman.

speaker: Martin
text: I saw Roz, so I hid outside in case that old gasbag of a mother was with her.  Well, I guess she wasn't, everybody's still awake.   **ROUGHING THE PASSER** _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Martin is watching the pre-game as Frasier paces nervously._

speaker: Martin
text: Look at those guys in the locker room.  Nervous, hearts pounding, probably a little sick to their stomachs, poor kids.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Until I got out of high school, I didn't there was any other way to feel in a locker room.

speaker: Martin
text: What's the matter with you?  You keep looking at your watch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Was I?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  Is there something on your mind?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, but there's something I wanted to talk to you about, but now's not the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now's the time.

speaker: Martin
text: Just let me get the door.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, Dad, that's what I have to talk to you about.  You see, that's going to be Roz and her mother.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Joanna had such a good time with you the other night, and you did say that you would see her again, and rather than send her home with her feelings hurt, I had to tell her you wanted her here.

speaker: Martin
text: What, like a date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's the beauty of it.  It's like a date, but it's not a date.  Just, you know, make small talk, you pass the dip.

speaker: Martin
text: No, Frasier, you don't understand...

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Dad, I know you found her a little less than scintillating, but please, it'll be over before you know it.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Bonnie.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Bonnie, glad you could make it.  Let me hold this. See, this is what I was trying to tell you, Frasier, I invited Bonnie.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking her coat_] Oh, how nice.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what do you got here?

speaker: Bonnie
text: Oh, it's my special deviled ham in the shape of a football. But I still need to put on some macaroni laces.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, the kitchen's right down there, just holler if you need anything. [_She heads over._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What did you invite her for?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, because I like her, and I thought I might want to ask her out, and I thought if she came over for the game it might be a step in the right direction.  I mean "like a date but not a date."

speaker: Frasier
text: Now that's gonna be Roz and her mother.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Should I put some coffee on while I'm in here?

speaker: Martin
text: You better, we're gonna need it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you come on, Dad?  Would it kill you to be civil for the length of one Super Bowl?  What is that, an hour out of your life?

speaker: Martin
text: Hi! [_The ladies shush them and motion to the baby._] Sorry.  Come on in.

speaker: Joanna
text: Thanks so much for inviting us.

speaker: Martin
text: Wouldn't be fun without you.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, could you show Mom where Alice can finish her nap?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure Dad would love to.

speaker: Martin
text: My pleasure, just come this way, Joanna.  So, you a big football fan?

speaker: Joanna
text: No, actually I've never even seen a game.  I was hoping you'd explain as we go along.

speaker: Bonnie
text: [_coming from the kitchen_] OK, who's hungry?  Oh, hey, I'm Bonnie.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, from McGinty's.  I didn't know you were coming.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Yeah, Martin invited me.  He was real cute about it.  He checked with all the waitresses to find out if I was single.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh. [_She looks questioningly at Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well you know how Dad is always trying to, ah...

speaker: Bonnie
text: Hey, the Coyote!

speaker: Frasier
text: Find a new girl for Niles.  Niles, you remember Bonnie. She waited on us at McGinty's.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, of course.  I'll have a vodka martini, very dry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't be silly, Niles.  Bonnie is here as our guest.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, your dad thought you two might hit it off.

speaker: Niles
text: [_not enthused_] Oh.

speaker: Bonnie
text: [_even less enthused_] Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: The Superbowl and a date.  Hot diggity!

speaker: Bonnie
text: Well, come here, you're just in time for my specialty.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I... [_She pops a cracker in his mouth._] Mmmm!  Isn't that interesting!  Something formerly ham.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_coming from her room_] Well, I'm off to the cinema.

speaker: Niles
text: You're not staying for the game?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry, but Ameican football's not for me, and they're showing "Wuthering Heights" downtown.  I think it's the most romantic movie ever made.

speaker: Niles
text: You're going alone?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, unfortunately.  It's more fun to go with someone, except of course it always ends the same way: Me weeping all over me date's shoulder while he does what he can to comfort me.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Oh, you should have seen me cry putting onions in this ham loaf.  I must've gone through a whole roll of toilet paper.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, enjoy your game.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, may I see you in the kitchen?

speaker: Martin
text: That's amazing!  You do all you do and you still have time to be a docent at the cheese museum on the weekends? Frasier, can I see you in the kitchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a second, Dad, I gotta take drink orders in here.  _Cut to the kitchen.  Martin comes in as Niles is rinsing his mouth at the tap._

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks for setting me up with that Spam-happy tootsy.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Niles
text: Bonnie.  Frasier told me you invited her here for me.

speaker: Martin
text: I invited her here for me.  He probably said I invited her for you because he didn't want to upset Miss Boring's feelings.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_entering_] Now, now, no private conversations.  Your dates are waiting.

speaker: Martin
text: They're not our dates!

speaker: Niles
text: We hate them!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now listen.  I realize that this is a very difficult situation, but if we all cooperate, we can send everybody home happy.  Dad, if you would like, you can discretely take Bonnie aside and tell her what's going on.

speaker: Martin
text: Bonnie, can I tell you something?

speaker: Frasier
text: I said DISCRETELY!

speaker: Joanna
text: I think the game is about to start.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that reminds me, I want to get Alice's bottle warming.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Oh, you have a baby?

speaker: Joanna
text: Oh, the most adorable little girl.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, she's a real beaut!  You oughta see her, Bonnie.

speaker: Roz
text: You can come with me if you want when I feed her.

speaker: Martin
text: No, you go ahead and get that ready, I'll show Bonnie, it's right through there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Dad, don't you get fresh with Niles's girl, there.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I won't if he won't.

speaker: Joanna
text: Your father is really smitten with that baby, isn't he?

speaker: Roz
text: I think he's just got a weak spot for the Doyle women.

speaker: Joanna
text: Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, he may appear to have a crusty exterior, but deep down inside, Dad's just an old softy.

speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o._] Well, there's the kid.  Kind of a goony-looking thing, isn't she?

speaker: Niles
text: Is that Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Look, Bonnie, I gotta tell you somethin'.  I didn't ask you here for Niles, I asked you here for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's the baby monitor!  We should just...

speaker: Joanna
text: [_grabbing it away from Niles and Frasier_] Shh.  I want to hear this.

speaker: Bonnie
text: But I thought you were with Joanna.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no.  Frasier and Roz set us up last week.  I told Frasier I thought she was a big snooze.  Especially compared to the fun you and I have at the bar, but he stuck me with her again.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I bet they know it's on...

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: And they're just having some fun with us...

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Joanna
text: Frasier, just stay put.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Then Niles isn't my date?  Oh, there's a relief.  I mean, no offense, Marty, but...

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you don't have to tell me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_grabbing his coat_] OK.  If anybody wants me, I'll be at the movies. [_He rushes out._]

speaker: Bonnie
text: So you really like me?  You're not just pulling my leg?

speaker: Martin
text: You want proof?

speaker: Joanna
text: I think we can turn this off now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Joanna, I am so sorry.  I know it sounded bad, but...

speaker: Joanna
text: No, no, not at all.  I'm sure your father meant "big snooze" in the most flattering sense.  Roz, maybe we should leave.

speaker: Roz
text: What were you thinking?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, I certainly wasn't thinking that he had a date planned.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm just going to get Alice.  Mom, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Joanna
text: Believe me.  Twenty years in politics, I've been called worse things than boring.

speaker: Joanna
text: Well, I hope you'll understand if I just slip out without saying goodbye to Martin?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, Joanna.  The last thing we need today is another awkward situation.

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s._] Whoa-ho-ho, Roz!  Knock, will ya?   _Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment. Fade in.  Frasier opens the door to Roz._

speaker: Roz
text: I left my diaper bag.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Can you come in for a bit?

speaker: Roz
text: I really shouldn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: It's all right.  I mean, I'm not gonna say that my mother wasn't hurt, but she did start to smile a little bit about it on the way to the airport.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I've been sitting here, trying to figure out why I was so eager to play matchmaker for Dad.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you're not alone.  I mean, I was excited once I thought it was going well.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suspect I wasn't doing it so much for him as I was doing it for me.  I see him here all the time, all alone, I wonder if maybe that's not gonna be me someday.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, God.  I think the same thing sometimes when I see these older ladies in my building.  They all want to babysit Alice just for the company.  I mean, she's a cute baby, but she ain't no Dorthy Parker.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, well, we're both gonna be fine.  I was just thinking, though, if we wanna play it safe, we could make one of those, uh, pacts.

speaker: Roz
text: You mean, like in forty years, if neither one of us finds anyone...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, exactly, we'll marry each other.

speaker: Roz
text: I was gonna say kill each other.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, six of one...

speaker: Credits
text: Niles is at Cafe Nervosa.  The waiter brings his cappuccino.  Angered at the amount of coffee, he pulls out his notepad and jots a complaint. He goes to put it in the suggestion box but as he gets there, Thad comes out.  Niles crumples the note and Thad holds up the trash can for him.  Niles ends up throwing the note past his head and runs out.   * * *  ## Guest Appearances    **Special Guest Star** EVA MARIE SAINT as Joanna Doyle  **Guest Starring** ALICE PLAYTEN as Bonnie ROCKY McMURRAY as Jimbo  **Guest Callers** PHIL DONAHUE as Larry MARLO THOMAS as Sophie   * * *  ## Quick Summary {nicholas hartley}    _ACT ONE  SCENE ONE - KACL_  Frasier is on air and is taking his last caller. It's a woman who says her husband is having a superbowl party on Sunday for his friends however he won't let her friends come over. The husband comes onto the phone and says he'll let them come over if he can answer a simple football question. Roz mimes the answers to Frasier in order he can get it correct. After signing off as "Coach Crane" he has a chat with Roz where she reveals that her mother is in town and has become a burden. Frasier suggests that she should start dating Martin to get her out of the house. So they agree to "accidentaly" meet at McGinteys.   Martin, Frasier and Niles are seated at a table as the waitress; Bonny comes over. She seems to know Martin. After greeting him she realises who Frasier is and talks about how proud Martin is of him. Then she turns to Niles and thinks he's a friend. Martin covers up saying "I've told you about my other son". However Bonny still gets it wrong and calls him Eddie. After she's left, some people from the Shang-ri-la enter who Niles trys to hide from. However they spot and proceed to play fight calling him the coyote. Niles explains his nickname: It went from Niles to Niley to Nile. E. Coyote and then just to coyote. However at that moments it's refined further as the shang-ri-la guys address him with a coyote growl. After this Roz and her mother, Joanna, enter. Frasier notices her and pretends he didn't expect her. He gets them to sit at the table - with Joanna next to Martin.   Everyone has finished eating however Martin & Joanna are the only ones who have cleared their plates. They explain how they never worried about calories in their day and how they ate full cooked breakfasts. Niles is disturbed by this. Roz suggests to Joanna that they better leave as they have a jazz concert. However, Frasier stops her and tells Roz they must discuss the promos. This was obviously planned as Roz decides to give her ticket to Martin so the two "love birds" can go off together. Joanna and Martin agree as Niles, Frasier and Roz leave saying that they have no idea it was a set up. However we see that they do know.   Daphne and Frasier are watching a "Miss. World" pagent whilst eating popcorn. Roz comes in looking worried, she explains her worry to Frasier. However he's not really listning to her as he watches her pagent making sarcastic comments with Daphne about the women. Roz explains how her mother MUST BE perfect, she says SHE NEVER makes wrong choices. Roz explains how Martin isn't right for her. Frasier is angered by this as he believes Roz thinks her mother is too high up to be dating someone as low down as retired cop. They begin arguing as Daphne trys to watch the television. Daphne gets up in a huff saying she just missed something before storming off to her room. Frasier tells Roz to stop worrying just before they hear the front door opening. Roz and Frasier quickly head to the sofa to look at the promos, as if they had been doing that all the time.  Martin and Joanna enter looking pleased with each other. They make little comments and it seems they want to see each other again. Joanna leaves so Martin can tell his TRUE side of the story to Frasier. Martin says that he actually hated the date. He says she droned on and on with boring facts; eg: the egg production in Wisconsin. Martin heads off to the room with the words "If you ever set me up on a date again, I'll kill you in your sleep!" Frasier is shocked by this and rather distressed.  Frasier rushes to the door, it's Roz. She looks really excited and explains how her mother had such a good time. Joanna cannot wait for a second date. Roz also says how a wall has been broken down between her and her mother. She says she will now talk openly about how she felt when her father left. She really is exstatic. At this point Martin walks out saying "her voice is still in my head". Frasier cannot bring himself to tell her that Martin hated the date and says "it's like a fairytale here too!"  _ACT TWO  SCENE ONE - CAFE NERVOSA_  Niles and Frasier are at the bar. Niles takes a drink from his cappuchino and he puts it down in disgust. He says that each week there gets more foam and less coffee. He decides to tell the waiter, however when he realises the waiter is a bit too macho for him he changes his mind and looks for the suggestion box. Frasier tells him about Martin's date and not being able to tell Roz. Niles tell Frasier he must do the right thing and tell the truth.  Roz enters and begins talking to Frasier. She says Martin hasn't rung yet. Frasier again can't bring himself to say anything so instead says he will. Roz looks at her calender and checks it with Frasier. He makes excuses up for every day. So Roz suggests that she brings Joanna up on Sunday to their super bowl party, which Frasier has no way of escaping out of.  She leaves and Frasier tells Niles the news, and that he must also be at the superbowl party. Niles gives Frasier some advice: to tell Martin about this five minutes before. If he tells him in advance he'll probably escape to McGinteys. So Frasier decides this is probably the best option in the long run.   Martin is watching the warm up before the superbowl on the television and Frasier swims around laying out food. The doorbell sounds and he takes Martin aside. He says it will be Joanna which just angers Martin. He answers the door, surprisingly, to Bonny who is carrying some food. She makes her way to the kitchen as Martin explains that he invited her over in order to ask her on a date. Frasier is distraught by this as he answers the door to Joanna. Joanna and Martin begin chatting before they take the baby away to a room.  Bonny then enters laying the food out and Roz inquires about why she's here. Frasier pretends that Martin invited her here for Niles. Bonny is confused by this. At this point Niles enters through the front door and hangs up his coat. He is shocked when he realises that Bonny is his date however he goes along with it to be polite. Daphne enters at this point and heads out the door - she explains she's going to see "Whuthering Heights" at the cinema by herself. She goes onto say how, if there was someone there, she would only end up crying in her dates shoulder.  After sampling one of Bonny's culinary "delights" he enters the kitchen. Martin enters just after him. Niles tells him off for setting him up with Bonny. Martin tells Niles he invited her here for himself, and that it was probably Frasier's idea so not to offend "Miss. Snoozey". Frasier enters the kitchen and tells them to see to the dates however Niles & Martin disagree saying they hate them.  They all enter the room where Joanna begins talking about the baby. Bonny asks to see the baby, so Martin takes her off. Unfortunately the baby monitor is switched on and the conversation about the dates are heard. Both Martin and Bonny don't like their dates. Upon hearing this, Niles takes flight in order to catch up with Daphne at the movies.  Joanna is a little disturbed by this but says she's not too offended. She leaves without saying goodbye to Martin. Roz follows her after shouting at Frasier.   Later on, Roz comes back up to his apartment and they talk about looking at their parents love life and comparing it with their own. They explain that they'll probably never get married and time is runnung out. Frasier says they should make a pact; like in forty years if they find no one they should marry each other. Roz says she was going to say "kill each other".
